prompt: The Contraposition equivalence shows that (P → Q) ≡ ?
hint: Flip both parts and negate them.
explanation: Contraposition: (P → Q) ≡ (¬Q → ¬P). If P implies Q, then not-Q implies not-P. They are logically equivalent - if one is true, so is the other.
visual_concept: If being human implies being mortal, then not being mortal implies not being human. Same logical content, different form.
